Sentencas: This study aims to provide a comprehensive environmental life cycle assessment of heat and power production through solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) fueled by various chemical feeds namely; natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: The life cycle assessment (LCA) includes the complete phases from raw material extraction or chemical fuel synthesis to consumption in the electrochemical reaction as a cradle-to-grave approach.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: The LCA study is performed using GaBi software, where the selected impact assessment methodology is ReCiPe 1.08.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: The selected environmental impact categories are climate change, fossil depletion, human toxicity, water depletion, particulate matter formation, and photochemical oxidant formation.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: The production pathways of the feed gases are selected based on the mature technologies as well as emerging water electrolysis via wind electricity.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: Natural gas is extracted from the wells and processed in the processing plant to be fed to SOFC.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: Hydrogen is generated by steam methane reforming method using the natural gas in the plant.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: Methanol is also produced by steam methane reforming and methanol synthesis reaction.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: Ammonia is synthesized using the hydrogen obtained from steam methane reforming and combined with nitrogen from air in a Haber-Bosch plant.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: Both hydrogen and ammonia are also produced via wind energy-driven decentralized electrolysis in order to emphasize the cleaner fuel production.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: The results of this study show that feeding SOFC systems with carbon-free fuels eliminates the greenhouse gas emissions during operation, however additional steps required for natural gas to hydrogen, ammonia and methanol conversion, make the complete process more environmentally problematic.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation

Sentencas: However, if hydrogen and ammonia are produced from renewable sources such as wind-based electricity, the environmental impacts reduce significantly, yielding about 0.05 and 0.16 kg CO2 eq., respectively, per kWh electricity generation from SOFC.
Titulo: Life cycle environmental impact comparison of solid oxide fuel cells fueled by natural gas, hydrogen, ammonia and methanol for combined heat and power generation
